message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.CY, cs.DC, cs.SI 

This paper deals with the abuse of code-signing certificates, which is a topic related to computer security (cs.CR). It also involves the study of malware and its relationships with certificates, which falls under software engineering (cs.SE). The use of certificates to bypass platform protections and the emergence of a new segment in the underground economy also touch upon topics related to cybercrime (cs.CY) and distributed computing (cs.DC). Finally, the use of data analysis and collection methods to study the certificate ecosystem can be considered as a topic related to social and information networks (cs.SI).
